Case reference: 2024001594.CaseDesc: Alex Marko was seen for the last time on December 5, 2023 in Winnipeg, Manitoba. He is known for using housing resources for the homeless.

Case reference: 2014006533.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1983, William Fosseneuve, Raymond Sewap and another person were aboard a boat on the Amisk Lake in Saskatchewan. During the course of their trip to Denare Beach, the trio encountered turbulent waters, which caused William to fall overboard. In an attempt to rescue him, Raymond dove into the water. Both men were last seen submerged in the water.

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2014002754.CaseDesc: On November 3rd, 1963, Charles Williams was seen operating a 12' outboard motorboat in coastal waters and did not return home.

Case reference: 2014005105.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2001, at approximately 8:00 p.m., Younes Taleb was seen for the last time at his mother’s business in Toronto, Ontario.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the right cheek

Case reference: 2005000899.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2005, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 29 and 50, was found in a wooded area on the embankment of a small creek off Queen Street in Bobcaygeon, Ontario. There are indications that this person suffered from early age-related osteoarthritis. It is believed that this individual had likely been at this location since 1994 or earlier.

Case reference: 2021052226.CaseDesc: On January 28, 2016, at approximately 1:45 p.m., Daniel Leslie was last seen at Terrapin Point, on the American side of Niagara Falls, in Niagara Falls State Park, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Daniel was despondent.

Case reference: 2014001095.CaseDesc: On the evening of April 11, 1998, the body of an adult female believed to be between the ages of 30-40, with long dark hair and blue eyes was found deceased at the Broadway SkyTrain Station in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was very lean and pale and was wearing a long red wool coat over jeans and black ankle boots.

Coat: Wool, Red, Long coat with hood

Case reference: 2014002407.CaseDesc: Robert Scott Ellis and a friend headed out fishing on June 27, 1973. They left in the morning around 9:30 am and fished until around 6:00 pm when they decided to return home. During the course of the day, poor weather rolled in and the water became quite rough. They started taking in water over the sides of the canoe. Despite the progress they made, one wave eventually rolled the canoe. Both men hung onto the canoe for hours, but Robert eventually tired and let go.  When the friend eventually reached shore, he reported the incident. Dragging and diving operations were initiated and the results were negative. Mr. Ellis is presumed to have drowned. No foul play is suspected in this case.

Case reference: 2020011625.CaseDesc: On or around January 15, 1975, John Hovey was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002748.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1981, Jerry Torarak was last seen at 11:15 p.m. He had been travelling back to Hopedale, NL from Railroads, NL via boat with family. Approximately 15 miles off shore from Hopedale, Jerry fell over board into the water and sank out of sight.

Case reference: 2014002220.CaseDesc: Melvin Hoel was last seen on May 12, 1997 in the Cataract Creek Provincial Recreation Area, Alberta, where his vehicle and all his belongings were found by Fish and Wildlife agents.

Case reference: 2014002404.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1988, Andrew Flett was walking with others to the cutline. He did not arrive at the site, and it was assumed that he had returned to camp. He was reported missing three days later to the RCMP, and an extensive search was conducted. Andrew has not been located, and his whereabouts are currently unknown.

Shirt: Red, Black, Plaid and button up

Case reference: 2006022399.CaseDesc: Jocelyn "Josh" Blais was last seen in a bait shop in Ignace, Ontario. He and a friend were headed to Cecil Lake (24 kilometres north of Ignace and 1 kilometre east off Hwy. 599) for a day of fishing. His overturned boat was later discovered.

Case reference: 2020010776.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1968, Samuel Hall was seen for the last time when he went out onto Lake Ontario for a fishing trip. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Blue, Grey, Work, Emblem with the letters "BA"

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2014005436.CaseDesc: On May 5, 2009, Mohamed Ibrahim was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016070902.CaseDesc: On November 9, 2016, Campbell Hunter was last seen in Thompson, Manitoba. Mr. Hunter is known to lead an outdoor lifestyle and it is unusual for him not to contact his family.

Case reference: 2014003214.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1982, Clyde "Van" Ditmars was reported missing to the Thunder Bay Police Service by his family. Van sought work in British Columbia, Alberta and Manitoba in the early 1980s as a welder. Since being reported missing, Van's family has not heard from him and his whereabouts are unknown.

Scar: Abdomen, Surgical; from the center of chest to the belt line and then to the left
Abdomen, Surgical, horizontal on the left side
Neck, 1 1-2" raised scar on front of the neck

Case reference: 2012020066.CaseDesc: On October 22, 1988, in the early evening Betsy Owens was playing volleyball at the local school in Pauingassi, Manitoba. At approximately 11:00 pm, Betsy left the school with her boyfriend, returning to his residence. Betsy was last seen by her boyfriend the following morning when she left his home. Despite several searches, Betsy's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2016000962.CaseDesc: On January 5, 2016, Felix Claveau was last seen when he jumped off the Viau Bridge into the Rivière-des-Prairies in Laval, Quebec. Felix hasn’t been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003781.CaseDesc: William Leslie has not been seen or heard from by anyone, including his family, since September, 1993. His belongings were found in a remote area. He had been staying in a tent in the bush Southeast of Beaverlodge in Alberta. It appeared the tent was pitched in the fall of 1993. William's belongings were located under 2-3 feet of snow, along with his truck and bicycle. A jean jacket and leather jacket were located in the truck.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Short on top and long in back
Tattoo: Left Arm, Text "live your own life" in a ribbon
Right Arm, Text "born to be bad" and "Mom Dad"

Case reference: 2014004386.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2003, Adolph Sewap was last seen in Sturgeon Landing near Creighton, Saskatchewan. Adolph had some medical issues and was known to travel to other communities.

Other: Walks bent forward with hands behind his back

Case reference: 2014001545.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Knife with snake, flower

Case reference: 2014005624.CaseDesc: Heinz Paul was last seen filling his vehicle with gas in Calgary, Alberta then driving west. Police investigations regarding Mr. Paul's whereabouts are currently ongoing.

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2014005537.CaseDesc: Kerry Klyne was last seen while working at the Dakota Hotel.  Mr. Klyne's whereabouts remains unknown.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Tribal art/Band around biceps

Case reference: 2014004934.CaseDesc: On February 28, 1976, at approximately 5:30 pm, Jean Cardinale was seen for the last at the Bayview Village Plaza in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006013699.CaseDesc: Emile Morissette was last seen while on a fishing trip at Birch Lake in Timmins Township, Ontario on July 6, 1976.

Case reference: 2014004730.CaseDesc: Geoffry MacGibbon was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. In 1978, Geoffrey and his family moved to Toronto, Ontario from Quebec. He is schizophrenic and has been in several mental institutions in Canada and the United States of America.

Scar: Front Of Neck, Tracheostomy scar on throat

Case reference: 2014004933.CaseDesc: On May 3, 1987, at approximately 7:00pm, Jimmy Hong was last seen by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. His friend indicated that Jimmy had left for Hamilton, Ontario, and would be returning the following Monday.

Case reference: 2018054180.CaseDesc: On May 8, 1992, John Leonard was seen for the last time when he borrowed a friend's vehicle.  Later that same day, the vehicle was recovered at Woodbine Racetrack in Toronto.

Shoes: Nylon, White, Running shoes with a low cut style
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Pair of dice

Case reference: 2009000299.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1989 at approximately 5:30 pm, Mr. George Giles and a friend left Mr. Giles' cottage on Fox Island in Lake Simcoe enroute to a marina at Island Grove.  Weather conditions were very poor at the time and the boat eventually capsized some distance from shore, after taking on water. His friend managed to swim back to Fox Island but Mr. Giles was not able to make it to shore, due to the treacherous weather and water conditions. On November 20th, 1989 the boat was discovered stranded on a sandbank near Joyland Beach in Orillia. Mr. Giles' body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2019010367.CaseDesc:
Simeon Bear was last seen on July 23, 1982 when he was last seen boating on Reindeer Lake,
heading out from Southend, Saskatchewan to Lawrence Bay during a storm.

Deformity: Right Hand, Disfigured index, middle and ring fingers

Case reference: 1999108210.CaseDesc: René Bessette was abducted when he was 8 years old by his father, Roger Bessette, leaving behind his mother and siblings.  His father's car was found abandoned later on the Victoria Bridge in Montreal.  The photos of René have been age-progressed to 40 years old.

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002353.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1978, two men found a racing canoe and called the police. During the ensuing investigation, it was discovered that there were two men in the canoe, apparently on their way to dig for Seneca root on Moose Lake in Manitoba. According to witnesses who saw the men leave, they left in adverse weather conditions, including high winds. Reuban has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014030834.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1967 at approximately 9:00 a.m. John Pawloski, his common-law wife and a young boy (9 years old) were fishing in the area of Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. John's fishing rod started to slip into the water and he ran to reach at it. He fell into the fast moving water. His wife attempted to rescue him, but she too slipped on the rocks and fell into the water. The young boy ran to get help and when he looked back he could no longer see the couple.  The body of John's wife was found down the river shortly after the incident. Searches for John's body were done by air, land and water but the body was never found. He is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014001046.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1990, the body of this middle-aged man was found on Gore Avenue in Vancouver, British Columbia. He died of complications related to chronic alcohol dependence.

Hair: Blonde, Long dark blonde hair with greying beard
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Young Life Creator brand
Shoes: Grey, Nike Air brand, running shoes

Case reference: 2014003550.CaseDesc: Kenneth James Schmit, who went by "Jimmy", was last seen leaving a social gathering at a home in St. Walburg, Saskatchewan at 10:30 p.m. on September 22, 1966. Kenneth was feeling despondent, and, at the time of his disappearance, he sported a heavy beard. Numerous searches of the area were conducted, however, he was not located.

Case reference: 2018063272.CaseDesc: On February 13, 2002, Wayne McMahon was seen for the last time by his building's superintendent in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2014002608.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1998, Jong Donohue was seen for the last time as he departed from Camrose, Alberta. It is possible that Jong may have had plans to travel to Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2020021517.CaseDesc: Ashley Collins was last seen on June 16, 2020 in Drayton Valley, Alberta. At the time of her disappearance, Ashley was leading a high risk lifestyle, and is diabetic.

Case reference: 2015037946.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2015, Raymond Flett was seen for the last time in Thompson, Manitoba. Raymond is known to frequent the Split Lake and Thompson.

Case reference: 2017076317.CaseDesc: Dakota Anzovino was last seen on December 23, 2017, in the City of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Boots: Tan, Black, Winter, Brand: "Sorel"; with white fur
Jacket: Black, Grey, Plaid with dark hood
Jeans: Denim, Grey, Light Blue, Or grey in colour

Case reference: 2006016899.CaseDesc: Lisa Maas was last seen leaving a party in the Woodford area.

Case reference: 2014004551.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1984, Robert Plewes was last seen at his residence in Toronto, Ontario. His truck was found six days later near Algonquin Park located in Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005984.CaseDesc: In 1972, Patricia Salamandyk was seen for the last time as she got off of the school bus with her sister in Spruce Grove, Parkland County, in Alberta. Patricia had told her sister that she was not going to school that day, and she has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2024026217.CaseDesc: On May 27, 2024, Galextra Kavanaugh left her Niagara Falls, Ontario home on foot at approximately 1:30 p.m. She was last seen on surveillance footage near Bridge Street. Galextra has a history of memory loss and early onset of dementia. Galextra has previously been located in Toronto and may identify herself as Selma Paul or Selma Caus.

Case reference: 2021030130.CaseDesc: On August 22, 2003, Gregory James was last seen in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2014001485.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1981, Mohamad Daher was seen for the last time as he left his residence, in the Anjou district in Montreal, Quebec, for a business meeting. His vehicle was found at Le Boulevard Shopping Centre in the Saint-Leonard neighbourhood. Mohamad has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003835.CaseDesc: On August 28, 1992, Janice Howe left her family home in Winnipeg, Manitoba driving her father's 1985 Oldsmobile Cierra, and has not been seen since. Janice's vehicle was located the following morning 19 km east of Kenora, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002926.CaseDesc: Maria Lindner was a passenger in a motor vehicle accident on February 22, 1980. Maria was not able to reach land when the vehicle entered the upper Niagara River.

Shoes: White, Nurses, Blue star and ribbed soles

Case reference: 2024000604.CaseDesc: Karan Patel was last seen near the Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario, on January 3rd, 2024, at approximately 12:30 pm. At the time of his disappearance Karan was feeling despondent.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Green, Ring
Shoes: Black, White, NIKE brand running shoes

Case reference: 2008023599.CaseDesc: Gordon Andrew Cameron was reported missing by a family member on March 26, 1993. He was last seen on February 28, at Lino's Restaurant and has not been seen or heard from since.  At the time of his disappearance he was self-employed as an auto-body repairman. His shop was located at Brule Road and Highway 2 in Kingston. Foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Case reference: 2022042745.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2022, Roman Perelstein was last seen in the area of Bathurst Street and Orchard Heights Boulevard in the Town of Aurora, Ontario. Family and friends have not been able to contact him. This is reportedly out of character.

Teeth: Missing 4 upper teeth, has dental prosthesis

Case reference: 2010000699.CaseDesc: William Ostertag last spoke to his brother on December 16, 1990.  He was reported missing when he failed to show up for his work Christmas party in North Bay.

Hair: Black, Short, Comb over, moustache, sideburns
Coat: May have been wearing a blue or grey coat

Case reference: 2014004449.CaseDesc: Fred Johnsen was last seen on August 28, 1979, leaving his family home near Old Forest Hill Road and Eglinton Avenue West in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016006283.CaseDesc: Larry Legacey was reported missing on March 22, 1993 when friends and family had not heard from him in several weeks. He was last known to reside in Edmonton, Alberta, but also frequented the Round Hill area, southeast of Edmonton. He also frequently traveled to Calgary, Alberta and to British Columbia.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Eagle and text "DAD HARLEY"

Case reference: 2013000013.CaseDesc: On April 27, 1967, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Marianne Schuett was seen for the last time in the vicinity of the Kilbride Public School's driveway in North Burlington, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Marianne was seen talking to an unknown man in a vehicle, and it is believed that she was abducted by this man.

Hair: Brown, Bangs in front, ear length at back

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2013000068.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1994, Yvon Ringuet was reported missing from his home in the Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie district in Montreal, Quebec. Yvon would call or visit his mother everyday. All his personal belongings were found in his home and no one has seen or heard from him since.

Tattoo: Cross, right or left upper arm

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2014004301.CaseDesc: Zolton Zambory was reported missing by his estranged wife on January 24, 1965. On January 30, 1965, Vancouver City Police located his vehicle abandoned in Vancouver. His vehicle was unlocked with his personal belongings left behind. He emigrated from Germany and arrived in Quebec on May, 1957.

Case reference: 2014003894.CaseDesc: Jean Gravel and Jean-Guy Champagne were employees of the Rio Bar in downtown Trois-Rivières. On July 6, 1972, they arrived at work in the early evening; they were to work there until closing. They never returned home and have not been seen since. They were reported missing on July 10, 1972.

Jewelry: Gold, ring on the left ring finger
Silver, wedding ring on the left ring finger

Case reference: 2014004547.CaseDesc: Ervin Moar is transient in nature and is known to frequent the Main Street strip of Winnipeg, MB. Mr. Moar has not been seen or heard from since June 3, 2004.

Case reference: 2006024099.CaseDesc: David Jennings was last seen on June 13, 1991. He is presumed to have drowned on Blackstone Lake in Archipelago Township.

Jacket: Silk, Blue, across shoulders "Bass Fishing"  picture bass fish

Case reference: 2014011272.CaseDesc: During the morning of June 10, 2014, Yvonne Wallace left her residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005011.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2005, at approximately 6:15 p.m., Senekinesh Qirma was seen for the last time at the Eaton Centre in Toronto, Ontario. Senekinesh was in Canada on a visitor’s visa.

Case reference: 2014002231.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1980, Heinz Gamper was seen for the last time when he went mountain climbing in Jasper National Park in Jasper, Alberta. Following this time, Heinz was scheduled to work, but he did not attend his scheduled shift.

Case reference: 2016061850.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1978, the body of a male was found in the snow on the east side of the Bayview Extension, near the east end of Labatt Ave, on the west bank of the Don River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 158lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Unshaven, beard and moustache
Coat: Dark grey winter coat with a checkered pattern
Pyjama: Blue, White, Blue and white patterned pyjama bottoms
Scarf: Black, blue and red plaid scarf
Shirt: Maroon, Black, Maroon and black sport shirt
Mark: Left Hip, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Right Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Left Abdomen, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Right Leg, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Thigh, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
3 scabbed abrasions around the left eye orbit.
Scar: Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars on a forearm
Abdomen, Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars
Shoulders, Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars

Case reference: 2023068017.CaseDesc: Earl Moberg was last seen on December 12, 2023 at the family home in the River East District of Winnipeg, Manitoba. Earl suffers from dementia, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Dark Blue, Green, Parka, dark blue or green

Case reference: 2018041450.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1999, Fakhri Daoud was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Fakhri had returned to his residence to gather some money, his passport, and some of his personal belongings. The day before, he had purchased a one-way flight ticket to Aman, Jordan.

Case reference: 2012000299.CaseDesc: Investigators with York Regional Police Homicide Unit are seeking assistance from the public in their investigation into the disappearance of a 45 year old woman. Cheryl Rowe was last seen by her family on December 22, 2011, just after midnight on Rathfon Crescent in the Town of Richmond Hill. The investigation is still ongoing and investigators believe that Ms. Rowe may be the victim of foul play.

Tattoo: Upper Back, children's names, two wings with the words "Shane" and "Christina"

Case reference: 2020008580.CaseDesc: On December 14, 1973, at approximately 8:30 am, Teresa Desa was seen for the last time at her family home in Toronto, Ontario. There is a possibility that Teresa ran away with the family’s tenant, Amavel Santos.

Coat: Brown, Light brown with white trim

Case reference: 2012020654.CaseDesc: On May 12, 1997, Darold Kishayinew was last seen at a relative’s house in Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2006028499.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1968, at approximately 4:30 p.m., Robert James Brown was last seen walking  from the Nazarene Camp to his home in the Village of Wilfred, Ontario. The Nazarene Camp was a Christian camp near Pefferlaw, where Robert's mother worked as a volunteer.  He never arrived home and was reported missing to the Georgina Township Police Service. There were reports that a person matching Robert's description was seen in the vicinity of Georgina Beach around the time that Robert was last seen. Numerous land and water searches failed to locate Robert.

Case reference: 2014004899.CaseDesc: Claude Barbier was last seen on November 16, 1996, with his girlfriend at the Cooke residence in Trois-Rivières. On November 18, 1996, the body of his girlfriend was pulled from the St-Lawrence River near St-Antoine-de-Tilly. Mr. Barbier has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004240.CaseDesc: Sheilagh Coleman was reported missing on August 22, 2000 by her mother. Her mother last saw her on August 1, 2000 when she visited her in Gibsons, B.C. The last reliable sighting of Sheilagh was believed to be August 21, 2000 by a neighbour. They saw her leaving the residence of her boyfriend on her bicycle. Numerous people were interviewed that were associated to her and was much contradiction regarding the dates and events in order of which Sheilagh was last seen.

Case reference: 2013000039.CaseDesc:
Darryl Ferneyhough went missing on the morning of Sunday, May 13, 2001. Darryl was seen at the
night club NRG on Gottingen Street at 1:30 a.m. and later seen at 3:40 a.m. running north on Gottingen Street in the area of the Marquee Club.

Case reference: 2024040404.CaseDesc: George Guilbeault was last seen leaving his home in North Cobalt (Haileybury), Ontario at approximately 8:30 pm on August 2, 2024 in his vehicle towing his boat.  The next morning, George's boat was found unattended on Lake Temiskaming, on the Quebec side of the lake.  Police found George's vehicle and empty boat trailer at the boat launch.  An extensive search effort by the Ontario Provincial Police and the Sûreté du Québec, including air and marine units and the OPP's Underwater Search and Recovery Unit, was conducted with no success.

Case reference: 2021048330.CaseDesc: On July 12, 2015, at approximately 7 :00 a.m., Dan Ingram was seen for the last time as he slipped and fell into the water near the Whirlpool State Park in Niagara Falls, New York.

Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014003424.CaseDesc: On December 5, 1992, Marie Trahan was last seen in Petit-Shippagan, New Brunswick.  Marie's abandoned vehicle was later located at the wharf.

Case reference: 2016068490.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1971, Mr. Georges Turcotte went missing from the Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec area. Georges was last seen at his home with his wife.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Snake or zig zag

Case reference: 2020028767.CaseDesc: In the late evening of August 24, 1975, Jean-Marc Meagher was seen for the last time in Berthierville, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014025774.CaseDesc: In August 2014, Pawel (Paul) Przybyla was reported missing by his family. He was last believed to be in the Edmonton, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2014001203.CaseDesc: On March 12, 2012, the body of a man was found in the ice of the St. Lawrence River near the Parc des Rapides in Lasalle. The man was not wearing winter clothes. A lighter in the right front pocket of his jeans was found.

Sweater: color burgundy with a collar and a zipper

Case reference: 2019009156.CaseDesc: Yves Guérin was last seen in January 1991, when he left his residence in Montréal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2015020929.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2015, Andrzej Popek was last seen at the Crawford Lake Conservation Area in Milton, Ontario.  Andrzej's abandoned vehicle was located the following day in the Conservation's parking lot.

Case reference: 2014005915.CaseDesc: On October 30, 2012, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Frank Fuernkranz was seen for the last time on vacation in Panama. Frank had left to go for a walk, but never returned.

Case reference: 2019041509.CaseDesc: On July 17, 2019, at approximately 10:00 am, Kevin Li was seen for the last time leaving his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002692.CaseDesc: Between September 3 and October 3, 1978, Jean-Jacques Sirois was seen for the last time in the Rosemont District in Montreal, Quebec. Jean-Jacques has not been seen or heard from since.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold ring with rectangular cubic zirconia

Case reference: 2017047885.CaseDesc: On July 31, 2017, Brayden Thibault was seen for the last time when he left Fredericton, New Brunswick to meet someone in the city of Moncton, New Brunswick. Brayden has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004957.CaseDesc: On New Year's Eve, 2002 an anonymous letter was received by the Vancouver Police Department. The letter referred to a female Vancouver sex trade worker who had disappeared one month earlier, at the end of November. The letter writer described the woman, admitted to killing her, and apologized to her family for taking her life. Investigators believe the letter writer was referring to Danielle Marissa Larue, and while her body has never been found, they believe that she was murdered. The letter writer knows what happened to Danielle, and police are hopeful that the writer will contact them again.

Case reference: 2014002482.CaseDesc: On January 29, 1994, Hubertus Fischer was seen for the last time as he was travelling, by car, to Seattle, Washington. On February 16, the vehicle was found abandoned on a forest service road near Seattle. During the time of his disappearance, Hubertus was residing in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2021042160.CaseDesc: On September 16, 2021, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Darren Werner was last seen at his residence in the town Niagara-on-the-Lake in Ontario. It is possible that Darren had gotten into an unknown vehicle.

Case reference: 2016017728.CaseDesc: Reid Chesney left a men's shelter in Halifax, Nova Scotia on April 4, 2016. Mr. Chesney lived a transient lifestyle and had very little communication with family members. He has not been seen or heard from since.
